newsitem.title: JAPAN: Concert to be listed in Tokyo, London, NY--BT-MCI.
newsitem.headline: Concert to be listed in Tokyo, London, NY--BT-MCI.

text.p: British Telecommunications Plc and MCI Communications Co said on Tuesday that Concert, the global communications company to be formed after their merger, would be listed in London, Tokyo and New York.

Asked about the timing of the Tokyo listing, Concert chief executive officer Gerald Taylor told reporters: "Shares of Concert will be available in Tokyo immediately following the merger of BT and MCI, which is expected this fall."
He did not comment on the timing for the listings in New York and London.
British Telecommunications chief executive officer Peter Bonfield said the company has not decided what percentage of shares will allocated to Tokyo.

MCI and BT agreed in 1996 to merge to form Concert, a global communications company. The deal still has to receive approval from the U.S. Federal Communications Commission, which is expected by the autumn.
